title: 111_hr5333
content: The Act titled "Children of Military Service Members Commemorative Lapel Pin Act" recognizes dependent children of Armed Forces members. The Act "Children of Military Service Members Commemorative Lapel Pin Act" introduces a new section in title 10, United States Code, for a lapel button to honor eligible children of active duty armed forces members. The button's design and eligibility will be approved by the Secretary of Defense. The Secretary of Defense will establish an application process for military members to request a commemorative lapel button for their eligible children. A fee must be paid for the button, covering manufacturing and distribution costs. The Secretary of Defense will establish an application process for military members to request a commemorative lapel button for their eligible children. A fee must be paid for the button, covering manufacturing and distribution costs. The limitation on the number of buttons is one per eligible child dependent, regardless of the number of times the member serves on active duty. If a person is a dependent of more than one member, they may receive a button on behalf of each member. The Secretary may replace a lost or damaged commemorative lapel button for military service members' eligible children upon application and payment. Eligible child dependent is defined as a dependent of a member of the armed forces. The Secretary of Defense will issue regulations for this process. The Secretary of Defense will issue regulations for replacing lost or damaged commemorative lapel buttons for eligible children of military service members. Regulations will be uniform across all armed forces. The Secretary of Defense should expedite the design, manufacture, and issuance of commemorative lapel buttons for children of military service members as authorized by section 1126a of title 10, United States Code. The Secretary of Defense will make commemorative lapel buttons available to children of military service members retroactively. The Secretary of Defense will provide a mechanism for eligible child dependents of Armed Forces members to apply for a commemorative lapel button. Members who served on active duty for more than 30 days since September 11, 2001, will be notified of this opportunity. The Secretary of Defense will notify eligible child dependents of Armed Forces members about the availability of a commemorative lapel button. Applications must be submitted within one year of the announcement. Costs, limitations, and exceptions from section 1126a of title 10, United States Code, apply to the presentation of a children of military service members commemorative lapel button.
